name: Conrad Hong Kong

reviews.text: This is my first stay at the Conrad Hong Kong and I hope not the last. The rooms, the service, the location, the lounge and my dinner at Nicholini's were all excellent. The beds were so comfortable. The room is big, the view was breathtaking and the service was as good as the Peninsula...in fact, the experience was better all around. My friend and I really enjoyed our dinner and Nicholini's, one of our best meals in HK. Being located above Pacific Place is no hardship and it is an easy walk to Admiralty station or even into town via Hong Kong Park. I had stayed at other Conrad's but this is by far the best. My only small criticism is the charge for the internet...the only place I had to pay in HK.
reviews.title: Really a first rate experience

reviews.text: Stayed as a stopover from Europe to Sydney for one night and one day in Hong Kong. Chose for the Conrad this time, while I normally would stay at the Mandarin Oriental. The experience was very good. I received a complimentary upgrade to a mountain view suite and that was very spacious. The king bed was enormous, the bathroom is perfect and the additional living room was great as well. Service was impeccable and the connection to the Pacific Place mall was very convenient. It is not a bargain, but is a great place to stay in Hong Kong.
reviews.title: Perfect service & perfect room

reviews.text: The Conrad is a good hotel for sure. I wouldn't typically stay there but I was speaking at a conference there so it made sense on this occasion. The main issues for me, which I have to say are not big issues and may or may not matter to others, but it is not as central as other hotels, like the Mandarin Oriental. For example it is probably a 15-20min walk from the HSBC building and there are hotels just as good closer than that. Again, it's not a major gripe as there are sufficient transport options, just a personal preference. Plus my other pet hate for any hotel is those that don't have free WiFi, that really aggravates me!
reviews.title: Good hotel, not quite as central as some

reviews.text: Aside from that the food in the hotel is good, the free teddy bear for my daughter was a nice touch as was the Nespresso for me. A morning without Nespresso is no morning at all! The rooms are nicely decked out and I like the pillow service as I do tend to find hotel pillows too soft, so they were very quick to remedy that.
reviews.title: Great room great location great service

reviews.text: It definitely ranks up there with the other better hotels so ultimately it will depend what you're doing, where you want to be located and what kind of rates you can get but if you do stay there you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Strawberries and Cream

reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights in April at the end of a cruise and had an outstanding visit. I chose the hotel specifically because of the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor and I was not dissapointed. I booked a harbor view room and it was worth it for the view. Rooms were beautifully done, especially the all marble bathrooms. As far as the service, this is a first class hotel in every aspect!
reviews.title: Deserves Its Excellent Reputation

reviews.text: I just finished my first stay in the Conrad, I normally use the Shangri-la or the Mandarin.
reviews.title: Will be staying here again

reviews.text: As I was staying over the weekend mid way through an Asia roundtrip, so I had a chance to use more of the facillities than I would on a normal use on a business trip.
reviews.title: Stayed here 5 times in 3 years and will be back

reviews.text: The gym is good, about 6 running machines (so no queueing in the morning), free weights, bikes and weight machines, sauna, steam room all in the basement so no natural light, but better than most.
reviews.title: More Holiday Inn than luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The outdoor pool was excellent, actually have some nice views over to Kowlooon and down through the canyons of Hong Kong. Beside the pool there is the outdoor eating and drinking area its nice to sit outside in the sunshine, or the dark, when you spend most of the trip locked in meeting rooms.
reviews.title: My Top pick when in Hong Kong
Opulent, almost on the stuffy side
reviews.text: Yes the service is great and the quality is overwhelming but it is very pricey and has a stuffy atmosphere. However, if you're a Diamond Member, go! The amenities are amazing and they treat you like royalty.
It is also conveniently located/attached to a mall and MTR station.
reviews.title: wonderful experience!

reviews.text: In the beginning, I was somewhat dissapointed about the hotel, as it was located quite distant from Kowloon. But later, we found out that it is walking distant to HK park, and there was a subway station just under the hotel . The hotel itself was very clean, and had wonderful harbor view (thought partly block by the building in between).
reviews.title: Bad service everywhere

reviews.text: The only drawback of the hotel was the pillow, it was too soft for our standard.
reviews.title: Great Service on Executive Floor

reviews.text: We did not have meals in the hotel, but the Zen restaurant at the shopping mall downstair was extraordinary!
reviews.title: Excellent
Good but could be better...
reviews.text: Given Conrad is the "better" sister of the Hilton siblings, I must admit we had "higher" expectations.
Our stay over the New Year's period was good but not great. Don't get me wrong, it is still a good hotel and I would recommend it but given the price and brand, we expected more.
reviews.title: Faultless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location wise, if you are looking for a fairly central hotel with easy access to the MTR, Conrad's a good choice. It sits above the Admiralty station. Coming from the airport on the airport line, you will need to switch trains. Take a cab from the airport if you have two or more persons travelling as it works out more or less the same.
reviews.title: good high end hotel

reviews.text: Although Conrad is on top of Pacific Place shopping mall, dining options (outside of the hotel and few restaurants in the mall) are limited unless you are happy take a 15-20 minutes walk towards Wan Chai.
reviews.title: truly the nicest hotel we've been in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room we got was on the 52nd floor. It was nicely decked out with plenty of nice touches, Nespresso coffee machine, Conrad teddy bear @ turndown service, daily plate with two fruits and two sets (heavy and light) of robes for each one of us.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed 4 nights and was extremely pleased overall. Neighboring JW Marriott is also excellent but I give a slight edge to Conrad.
reviews.title: Great Hotel of Pacific Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PROS:
reviews.title: Fabulous HK stay!

reviews.text: -room upgrade: as a Hilton Diamond member, was upgraded to executive level room this time as well as my previous visit last year. Not a harbor view room, but Peak view was just fine.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, Horrible Customer Service

reviews.text: -complimentary full breakfast for Diamonds: your choice of the executive lounge or the Garden Cafe in the lower lobby. While the lounge offerings are more than adequate, the Garden Cafe is an incredible spread of Chinese and western cuisine. A no-brainer decision-- go downstairs to the Cafe.
reviews.title: Strategic location!

reviews.text: -fitness center: spacious, good cardio machines with TV's, luxurious locker room
reviews.title: Great hotel and awesome staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a five star hotel, make no mistake about it. Everything from our arrival at a very late hour to the smooth late check out five days later was impressive. The airline managed to lose my luggage in transit. When I mentioned this at check in, they sent me an "emergency kit" with a few essentials in it. The room, the decor and the general ambience of the hotel was all exactly as a hotel of this calibre should be. You do get what you pay for. The only negative thing I will mention however, is that the staff do get a bit above themselves. There were two instances when I was actually tempted to report a couple of the waitresses to the duty manager but generally, our stay was very comfortable, restful and we would certainly stay there again. The dulcet tones of the lounge singer in the lobby bar was a welcome respite in the evenings along with the slightly potent cocktails. The location above Pacific Place is perfect for wandering around Central and Admiralty. The restaurant on the lower ground floor was consistently good. Breakfast was a little bit of a rip off but this is HK and hotels are expensive across the board, especially the better ones.
reviews.title: Slick service for your money

reviews.text: All in all, a five star hotel for five star prices.
reviews.title: amazing hotel!!!

reviews.text: This hotel is just perfect,nothing was less than perfect:
reviews.title: One of the best hotels of Hong Kong

reviews.text: great room,comfy beds,many pillows,luxury linens,huge bath tub,stand up shower,seperate toilets,soft carpets,fresh towels,very nice view,amazing service,smiling staff,nice swimming pool,2 jacuzzis.All was just perfect!
reviews.title: Love the crispy chicken at this hotel chinese restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed with 2 kids for 2 nights and loved it.Luxury 6 stars!
reviews.title: Excellent Concierge Flooor

reviews.text: Great Business hotel with a bit more flair. Nice big bed and rooms. Wind down was a nice touch, with a little teddy bear, but this hotel excels in location! You are an elevator ride away from Pacific Place- not many other hotels can claim that (with exceptions)...
reviews.title: Nice Business Hotel, GREAT location

reviews.text: Overall fantastic hotel, only thing that lacks is a bit of style/decor or culture aspect but can't really nitpick as this is a business hotel after all..
reviews.title: Superb, but ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this great hotel for the third time this year. As I have diamond status I was immediately put on the 59th floor and as usual service, rooms etc. were great.
reviews.title: Fantastic experience! Top notch hotel and service.

likes.liked: — The service, the view, the room and amenities

reviews.text: The only thing I continue to critisize is the extra money such a hotel wants from you for the use of in-room internet access.
reviews.title: Can't wait to return

reviews.text: The smallest Hampton Inn, also part of the Hilton chain, less posh and a lot cheaper offers this service for free. A logic I fail to understand.
reviews.title: Great for a Business Stay

reviews.text: This hotel certainly sets the benchmark for 5 Star service-
reviews.title: Conrad HongKong-5 Star service benchmark

likes.liked: — large airy. clean room with excellent bathroom appointments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: kudos to hotel management-well trained, attentive,polite and helpful staff from the front desk to knowledgable concierge.
reviews.title: Conrad Hotels in Asia are Wonderful!

likes.liked: — The views and the food in the various restaurants.

reviews.text: The room was large and clean and the signature teddy bear and rubber duck was a nice touch. Views out facing the harbour were great also.
reviews.title: Room is small & little bit old.

reviews.text: Location is tops-with easy links to Pacific Place /Queensway Plaza shopping and transport is a cinch with Admiralty MTR station near by and linked airconditioned walkways to Central MTR HongKong.
reviews.title: A most pleasant stay

reviews.text: Thankyou for making my stay a memorable one!
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Pacific Place! Designed to WOW for the price you pay!

likes.liked: — The Signature Conrad Teddy Bear & Conrad Rubby Ducky
likes.disliked: — Fairly long walk to the MTR

aka: Conrad Hong Kong Hotel Hong Kong
